Amber Heard Now a mother in Between Lawsuits

INTRO: While the entertainment industry has been living up to its name, Fantastic Beasts actor, Johnny Depp, and Aquaman star, Amber Heard’s supporters have been anything but. This has been more so highlighted in the newly taken up role of Heard as a single mother of Baby Oonagh Paige Heard. Yes! A mother! This celebrity news has totally changed the game for Heard in between lawsuits and a number of her supporters have turned against her. 

We will fill you in on the latest Amber Heard motherhood timing cuppa and how this can be of advantage to her losing lawsuit position against Johnny Depp. I hope you all are prepared, and are pumped as we are ready to spill some brewing celebri-tea. Maybe grab some snacks, click the subscribe button, and turn on the notification bell with your Cheetos-covered-finger if you haven’t yet! Now, let’s get on with the video:

To give you a quick timeline rundown, last 2015, Johnny Depp and Amber Heard made headlines when they married in their Los Angeles home. The then couple has touched the hearts of many with their intimate ceremony. However, who would have thought that their divorce and the lawsuits that followed would break the Internet harder than the news of their marriage and even six years later! In 2016, Heard accused Depp of domestic violence and has called for a divorce. Since then, both parties have retaliated with their differing narrative of the same story. Heard has consistently stated in court and in various interviews that Depp had serious substance abuse which would cause him to be violent towards her. Bruised and disturbed Amber would show up in court and vividly recount Depp’s allegedly abusive behavior. 

Depp denied all claims and was strengthened by accounts of his co-stars and supporters. “My husband and I will never forget the sweetness, protection, and kindness he treated me with during every single step of that [pregnancy] process,” Penelope Cruz, Depp’s co-star in ‘Pirates of the Caribbean’ shared in defense of Depp. In the same year, Heard then withdrew her restraining order appeal on the grounds of domestic violence and received a $7 million settlement. 

In 2019, Depp sued Heard for $50 million defamation over a 2018 Washington Post op-ed on which has been pushed, yet again, to next year. “I spoke up against sexual violence — and faced our culture’s wrath. That has to change,” Heard manifested. Especially in this contemporary social climate where a fight for oppressive behaviors is strengthened, her story as a “survivor of domestic abuse” quickly gained an audience. Talking about change, Depp did not brush this off. 

Depp’s lawsuit appealed that Ms. Heard’s allegations of abuse, even with no mentions of Mr. Depp’s name, is false and reflects a perpetrator character. “They were part of an elaborate hoax to generate positive publicity for Ms. Heard and advance her career.”On Ms. Heard’s side of the fence, she pursues a $100 million defamation countersuit against Mr. Depp. The significance of the Depp-Heard controversy has taken the Internet into a whirlwind no one is wanting to miss! While Depp has been continuously dragged by Heard with various accounts of physical and verbal abuse, the Internet is yet to side with her. Videos and phone recordings have surfaced featuring an abusive and manipulative Heard towards her then-husband. “I can’t promise you I won’t get physical again. God, I f---ing sometimes get so mad I lose it,” Heard admitted in a phone recording released in 2020.
tags: johnny depp amber heard audio reaction
amber heard johnny depp fight video
